name: Heritage and Values of the US Air Force I  Credit
description: Course Description: Designed to introduce students to the United States Air and Space Forces. Provides an overview of the basic characteristics, missions, and organization of the Air and Space Forces.

name: Heritage and Values of the US Air Force II  Credit
description: Course Description: Designed to introduce students to the United States Air and Space Forces. Provides an overview of the basic characteristics, missions, and organization of the Air and Space Forces.

name: A  Leadership Laboratory I  Credit
description: Course Description: A dynamic and integrated grouping of leadership developmental activities designed to meet the needs and expectations of prospective Air and Space Force second lieutenants and complement the AFROTC academic program. Student planned, organized, and executed practicum conducted under the supervision of the Detachment Commander and Operations Flight Commander. Mandatory for students who are members of ROTC or are eligible to pursue a commission as determined by the Detachment Commander.

name: B  Leadership Laboratory I  Credit
description: Course Description: A dynamic and integrated grouping of leadership developmental activities designed to meet the needs and expectations of prospective Air and Space Force second lieutenants and complement the AFROTC academic program. Student planned, organized, and executed practicum conducted under the supervision of the Detachment Commander and Operations Flight Commander. Mandatory for students who are members of ROTC or are eligible to pursue a commission as determined by the Detachment Commander.

name: Air Force Team and Leadership Fundamentals I  Credit
description: Course Description: Provides a fundamental understanding of both leadership and team building. Designed to prepare students for field training and leadership positions in the AFROTC detachment.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AS 101, may be taken concurrently.Term Offered: Fall.

name: Air Force Team and Leadership Fundamentals II  Credit
description: Course Description: Provides a fundamental understanding of both leadership and team building. Designed to prepare students for field training and leadership positions in the AFROTC detachment.

name: Leading People and Effective Communication I
description: Course Description: Utilizes field training experience to take a more in-depth look at leadership. Special emphasis on enhancing communication skills, and why that is important as a leader. Opportunity to try out these leadership and management techniques in a supervised environment.

name: Leading People and Effective Communication II
description: Course Description: Utilizes field training experience to take a more in-depth look at leadership. Special emphasis on enhancing communication skills, and why that is important as a leader. Opportunity to try out these leadership and management techniques in a supervised environment.

Mandatory for students who are members of ROTC or are eligible to pursue a commission as determined by the Detachment Commander.
prerequisite: Prerequisite:  AS 296A or AS 296B.Term Offered: Fall.

name: National Security/Commissioning Prep I
description: Course Description: Provides the foundation to understand role as military officers and how they are directly tied to our National Security Strategy. Overview of the complex social and political issues facing the military profession.

name: National Security/Commissioning Prep II
description: Course Description: Provides the foundation to understand role as military officers and how they are directly tied to our National Security Strategy. Overview of the complex social and political issues facing the military profession.
